article.headline: UC Santa Barbara 71, UC Irvine 58
article.story: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. -- James Nunnally and Orlando Johnson scored 22 points each and UC Santa Barbara defeated UC Irvine 71-58 on Thursday night. Nunnally made 8 of 14 shots for the Gauchos (9-6, 2-2 Big West) and Johnson was 8 of 17 and also pulled down seven rebounds. Eric Wise led the Anteaters (7-10, 1/3 Big West) with 18 points and 10 rebounds while Daman Starring and Mike Wilder had 11 points each. UC Santa Barbara, which led at 45-36 at halftime, saw its lead shrink to 51-47 on Darren Moore's jumper with 6:08 remaining. The Gauchos closed the door with a 7-0 run -- a 3-pointer by Jordan Weiner (12 points) and two layups from Johnson -- to make it 58-47 with 2:43 remaining.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
